title: Vodka-Poached Shrimp with Bloody Mary Cocktail Sauce
summary: Vodka-Poached Shrimp with Bloody Mary Cocktail Sauce is a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and pescatarian recipe with 8 servings. For 82 cents per serving, this recipe covers 2% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One portion of this dish contains around 4g of protein, 0g of fat, and a total of 57 calories. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. A mixture of vodka, peppercorns, jumbo shrimp, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 1 hour and 25 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 12%, this dish is rather bad. Try Vodka-soaked Shrimp With Bloody Mary Cocktail Sauce, Bloody Mary Shrimp Cocktail, and Bloody Mary Cocktail Sauce for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Shrimp works really well with Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 23 dollars.

productMatches.title: St. Michael-Eppan Anger Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Depending on the soil and microclimate, Pinot gris varies from a simple everyday wine all the way up to absolute top growths. The warm, sun-exposed vineyards of the Anger sites, with their loamy limestone gravel soils, are a textbook example. The Anger Alto Adige Pinot Grigio has a noble structure, nice balance and fine acidity â€“ making it an absolute pleasure to drink. The strong white goes well with fish and fish soup, guinea fowl breast or veal fillet.

instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add shrimp, and cook 2 to 3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink. Drain. Chill shrimp 1 hour. Serve with Bloody Mary Cocktail Sauce.

steps.step: Combine first 4 ingredients in a large saucepan; bring to a boil over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp, and cook 2 to 3 minutes or until shrimp turn pink.
Serve with Bloody Mary Cocktail Sauce.
